website_summaries.verdict: With its many overclocking controls, great audio system, and unique shape, this slick matte black and gold motherboard runs even smoother than it looks.

customer_reviews.title: I had no idea EVGA boards were this good
customer_reviews.text: I love this board. It's a dream to work with. I've punished way more than it deserves, and it keeps on chugging along. Note that I did run into some VRM issues that're common with all x299 boards, but I will say those only occurred at significantly higher core clocks on the extreme processors, and even then the board's cooling solution is pretty damn good. I only noticed slight throttling on stress tests, and had 0% real-world problems.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Amores

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. I used the i9 processor along with ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I used the i9 processor along with 64gb of ram, samsung evo installed on the motherboard and this boots up fully into windows desktop ready to go in less than 10 seconds. Great product if you looking to use only one GPU. This motherboard can support two GPUs but I recommend that both be liquid cooled since they are stacked next to each other.
customer_reviews.author: Reynaldo Juarez

customer_reviews.title: Well Built
customer_reviews.text: EVGA does things right. The board is tough, easy to install and has tremendous amount of overclocking features. I would have given 5 stars, but I had to completely remove the MB after initial build to replace the CMOS battery. These got shipped with a dead CMOS Battery and EVGA is aware of it. Please replace it before you do your build. It requires 4 small screws to be removed from underneath the MB. Impossible to do without removing the whole MB in 99.9999% of cases.
customer_reviews.author: EH

customer_reviews.title: RAID10 Limitations
customer_reviews.text: Removed three stars because the manual is misleading. The following statements are currently inaccurate: "This motherboard series supports a four (4) drive or a six (6) drive RAID10 array." "While the X299 FTW-K controller will support a four or six drive RAID10 array, RAID10 can scale indefinitely provided the controller supports more drives." This motherboard will only do four drives in a RAID10 array with the eight available on-board SATA ports. Know that before going out and purchasing six drives with a compatible chassis. The manual needs work, but otherwise it's a great motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Jeoncha

customer_reviews.title: TOP... NOTCH!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super amazed at this boards capabilities. I needed to learn a few new things, which was fun. But out of the box, it clocks your CPU to optimal performance. Be aware that this isn't a "workstation" replacement. This chipset is specifically built for HEDT overclockers, not like X58, X79, X99 series workstation chipsets. It's finicky unless you LEARN how to make it sing to you. Rest assured that higher memory clocks AND lower timings will be more stable, and CPU's will rage... without the VRM temps budging. LOVE this board!! And STILL learning its secrets.
customer_reviews.author: B3L13V3R

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing board, was really close to buying the Rampage ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing board, was really close to buying the Rampage VI Apex but decided to buy the x299 Dark instead due to the VRM components used on this board. The build quality of the board is also top class with a massive heatsink on the underside of the board which i've never experienced before in any motherboard and with Active VRM cooling what more can you ask for.
customer_reviews.author: gavin

customer_reviews.title: Bent CPU Socket Pins on Motherboard - Common EVGA
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and left Asus for EVGA FTW Z390 motherboard, what a mistake, I end up with bent CPU socket pins. I never had this issue with any other motherboard. Screwed up my intel gaming build, had to delay and setup a return and refund and order new Asus Maximus VI Board, which I should have purchased in the first place, just was hoping for the best, now I know why the EVGA Z390 board has been removed from being in stock at any store or outlet, that should have scared me away, but I am a sucker for a good deal I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Zeciri

customer_reviews.title: Honest review from a computer enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: Great board I love the slight rgb lighting it has and it’s just one smexy mobo and the over clockablity is great the bios is easy I love that the reset button is a hard drive indicator light as well and the vrms stay nice and cool
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Shipped with wrong bios chip
customer_reviews.text: Probably a great board, but was shipped out with the wrong bios chip, and couldn't even post to do an update. After a couple hours of trouble shooting and an hour on the phone (on 1/11) found out I might get the chip by 1/17. Guessing the board would work great at that point, but with a 1/17 deadline to meet, my system is currently useless and I'm going to have to go with another board. For the record, I believe it's jus the i9 10XXX chips that are impacted by this. TLDR - don't purchase if you're in an enterprise environment or have critical tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Tahnee Sauer

customer_reviews.title: Finally - everything you want in a board and nothing you don't
customer_reviews.text: If you're anything like me, you hate how boards have been including tech that we don't want on our boards, i.e. onboard vga, ps2 ports, dual nics etc... this board has everything I want and nothing I don't. I doubt a board like this will come along again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Double check everything, but man it’s a beaut!
customer_reviews.text: Pro: -Fans everywhere -Loads of PCI Slots -Optional Overclocking in BIOS software that actively measures your system capabilities to run maximize its performance. - Looks cool and feels durable. Con: -If your going SLI only one card will be able to fit in the slot with the fan, unless you do further modifications to your GPU’s. Needs an additional 6 pin PCIe power connector for the extra fans, on top of the 2x 8 pin connectors for the CPU. *TIP* There is a tiny box in the top corner with 5 pin sized white switches. They turn your PCI Slots on and off. I had one turned off when it arrived and it took awhile to identify it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Headers are Horizontal To The Motherboard - Case Issues
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to use this board in my Corsair 500D RGB as the power supply shield blocked the 90 degree horizontal headers. Wanted to like this motherboard, but now it looks like I need to return it and pick one that has upright header pins.
customer_reviews.author: Geraldo V.

customer_reviews.title: Research before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: My last build is 12 years old and still going strong, going to give it to my son. Got a 10 year manufacturers warranty, if it's not repairable they will replace it (If it's not available I will get a new one of equal or better quality).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Older motherboard, but works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with an intel i9-10920X, Cascade Lake, CPU. The board is a couple years old, but with an updated bios and everything seems to work just fine. One note on installation, the RGB covers have screws that go in from the back, so put them on before you mount it in the case. The graphical bios is good, as is the overclock utility. I had it do a "simple" overclock, all 12 cores running stable at 4.6 GHz. The price is excellent as well! I'm not sure why Amazon is asking me about the Warmth, thickness and sheerness of a motherboard, but meh :)
customer_reviews.author: Trapper_John

customer_reviews.title: 2 bad boards in a row
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy this board I have had 2 bad ones in a row and it put my project at work behind. Tried at first with a i7 6700k then tried a i9 9900k even with 2 different types of memory both will not post. I bought a asrock to replace this and it booted the first try.
customer_reviews.author: ryan mcmahan

customer_reviews.title: Evga X299 Dark
customer_reviews.text: Evga X299 Dark came with bent cpu pins from the factory.I found out this is a common issue on the X299 boards.Evga will not replace this board so i stuck with a broken board and got rip off of hundreds of dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Twinkie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: First problem, that there was no screws for cover for slots. But main problem that board doesn't work. Pc just doens't start. I replaced it with MSI motherboard and everything was fine. So i am 100% sure that problem was in board. I returned it, and will never buy motherboard from evga again, and don't advice do it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Angmarec

customer_reviews.title: Board works, onboard audio is horrible
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how big of a step down going from a z370 to an h370 board would be. It doesn't even support XMP. I don't blame the board for that, but it's surprising in 2018. The real problem with this board is the onboard audio output is so distorted that it isn't even usable for basic office tasks. On an ITX board with no room to add a sound card that is a deal breaker. Update: Wifi has died on the board so it's going in the dumpster after ~2 years. No more EVGA products.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: DOA from Amazon Warehouse
customer_reviews.text: Bought this board from the Amazon Warehouse. After purchasing the other items to complete my build. I discovered the board is junk, so I contacted evga and set up a RMA. But the the RMA was denied they said the board was damaged. So I am out of the money I paid Amazon and must purchase a new board. But lesson learned, I won't be purchasing from their warehouse again.
customer_reviews.author: A'ton

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: DNB do not buy.. Failed after few days of use 3 beeps — 3 beeps and powercycle
customer_reviews.author: Sahbi Al Kadeem

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard, easy to configure. I wasn’t paying attention and didn’t notice it does not have an onboard video adapter, so make sure you have that. I’m using the mobo for a headless ESXi server so video wasn’t really important. If you’re using this on a gaming system or for video intensive work, you’d want a discreet video adapter anyway.
customer_reviews.author: withanHdammit

customer_reviews.title: Runs fast, limited to 64GB RAM, get your own WiFi
customer_reviews.text: After working the bugs out with various CPU and RAM combinations, turned out to be a stable, fast board with i9-7960x. With 64GB capacity, it is enough to support most video/3D workstations, though 128 is better for pro and scientific work. Did not come with a usable WiFi setup.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent.
customer_reviews.text: Its an amazing board. I have a 7900X sitting comfortably inside of it with 32Gb of RipJaw 3200hz and a 1080ti FTW3. Board has great temps, and great functionality. The onboard temp display helps greatly. I do wish it had external usb ports on the board...but other then that...its amazing
customer_reviews.author: Nico

customer_reviews.title: Evga X299 FTW K
customer_reviews.text: Very good Quality board from Evga for the price and performance. The RGB feature is nice but I am not sure that it has the ability to sync with other RGB software. Bios is very easy to configure and I had no problem with my I9-10900X as the board came with 1.21 version and I upgraded it to the new 1.23 version. I added a wifi/bluetooth module to it also as it does not come with one but I had one already to use in it. The only thing this board could use is one more internal 3.0 port and some RGB headers for add on led strips.
customer_reviews.author: Bubble Gum Guru

customer_reviews.title: Great MotherBoard for the Demanding user
customer_reviews.text: very nicely designed board well laid out plenty of everything a gamer's Delight ! My Build: i9-7980Xe , (2) 2080ti fe , G.skill Trident-z, 3,600mhz ,(2) 970 pro M.2 1tb ,1.6kw psu . I have used this board for Gaming 4k , Folding@home Stable O.C of 4.4ghz , prime95 (Torture test 20mins Small FFt's Cpu 84C.) Vrm's Stayed solid and cool . I can say I'm very pleased with this item .
customer_reviews.author: JLM7424

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: Why not buy? These arrive with old bios and if you want to use latest Intel CPU for example i5-9600k or better it would not work unit you update CPU. Unless you have older CPU laying around to update BIOS, good luck. EVGA support is useless as well, RMA turn around is 2 weeks, help is nowhere to be found, nor they really care.
customer_reviews.author: Rome

customer_reviews.title: outdated no reason to buy in 2020
customer_reviews.text: expected high end desktop line currently on sale to outperform current consumer lineup. nope. noticeably slower than my i7-9700 rigs, even on a workload which scales near linear with memory bandwidth (ddr channels) disappointed this is still being marketed, I am the fool parted from his money by marketing.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Fails to boot into any OS.
customer_reviews.text: Fails to boot a windows partition, 2 Linux live USBs and a windows live USB no matter the bios settings. Don't waste your money or time buying this motherboard EDIT: After talking to customer support at EVGA, it came to light that the motherboard I was given had a bios version v1.01, whereas the EVGA tech support informed me that the earliest release of this motherboard shipped with v1.02. Amazon must have done some very shady things behind the scenes to make that happen, as v1.01 bios flash isn't even offered on the manufacturer website. My rating still stands though: 1/5 stars. Don't buy computer parts online. Go to Microcenter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael park

customer_reviews.title: The best mother board for i9900k
customer_reviews.text: This my second evga Z390 dark, same setup: i9900k, 2080ti, 4000mhz memory. This motherboard with the opción OC robot, overclock the cpu to 5.2ghz. Push the 2080ti to max, super smooth gaming experience.
customer_reviews.author: gonzalo

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: I've used this MB for quite some time now and I've had it run a 8086k @ 5.3ghz AVX 0 up to a 9900k P0 @ 5.2ghz AVX 1 all CB15, CB20, RB2.56, Aida64 certified with no problems. This board is a serious workhorse! But I would expect nothing less from EVGA.
customer_reviews.author: Electrosoft

customer_reviews.title: Except no substitute
customer_reviews.text: If you're reading reviews here to help reinforce your decision as to whether or not you should get the z390 Dark... STOP. Order it now. There is none greater. It's the best z390 board, period, for no matter what you use it for. Feature rich, highest quality, amazing 3 year manufacturer warranty. If you're still reading this, slap yourself, hard, and buy it now. Worth_every_single_penny.
customer_reviews.author: Dozer

customer_reviews.title: Great product a quick summary.
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived quickly with most or all of the accessories i could expect on a used middle/high end workstation board like this. The board comes equipped with dual BIOS, one of which was not properly booting out of the box. Resetting the BIOS with a small button on the IO face of the motherboard solved it. A strong motherboard with actively cooled vrm and power delivery, it including a handful of enthusiast features makes this feel like a steal at any price lower than the msrp.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: WTH
customer_reviews.text: I been Asus guy as long as I can remember, and I must say this board beats even the Rampage IV extreme IMHO new bios looks good and without all the rainbow lights and other useless crap this is the board to own.
customer_reviews.author: Det

customer_reviews.title: Great Motherboard!
customer_reviews.text: Great mobo. Haven't had any problems overclocking the i9-7980xe! Keeps vrm very cool and plenty of usb hookups
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: Definately worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This mobo beat all my expectations, since day one i have not had one issue, im running a 7900x, wakercooled by ekwb, samsung 970pro m2 drive, 64gb corsair dominator platinum, im running a evga 1080ti but i dont really game, and an evga 1200w platinum power supply. My pc runs very stable, fast its been about 6months and everything runs really smooth
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this motherboard
customer_reviews.text: New built.. Dark Mtherboard boot in the first try. Had to upgrade BIOS but that went smoothly . Sad is not PCI4 even when it says it is.. After 15 days no issues
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Received item, unfortunately it shows DIMM error, red LED. Not booting. Noted the CPU socket damaged. Disappointed. Now need to get support replacement.
customer_reviews.author: coolguy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Motherboard - Great BIOS and Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was simple and all the connections were easy to access. One downside is no onboard WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Jim T.

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: If you would like a small board with a lot of power, this is it. Pair it up with an EVGA video card and your all set.
customer_reviews.author: woodman

customer_reviews.title: OCs like a boss
customer_reviews.text: Got this thing in 2018 after a few price drops and I must say this thing crushes. Got a 7900x to 4.8 @ 1.25V fairly easily after a delid.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: eVGA is the way to go for me
customer_reviews.text: My new Z390 FTW has it all and worked on the first try with no issues. Hassle free!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: best x299 mobo!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these and love them. Replaced my rampage VI and apex for these. great VRM cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Zielin

customer_reviews.title: If you're an enthusiast, this is your board
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard doesn't cut any corners. Best build quality i've ever seen on a motherboard. With the price tag, it should be. Only complaint is that the motherboard is a little finicky with recognizing certain DP inputs.
customer_reviews.author: ManOrMachine

customer_reviews.title: The Best Customer Service and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Had all the features I needed. TPM built into the motherboard, though that isn't documented in the manual. Customer Service is great (available until 10PM PST). It's an American company located in Southern California. Build quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: Astounding
customer_reviews.text: The RGB looks amazing and the whole thing is just so awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Sloan

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: this thing is amazing, it even comes with a full size map that tells what everything is, witch was a big help considering i was building my first pc and had no clue what i was doing
customer_reviews.author: Robert A.

customer_reviews.title: Big, beautiful, powerful
customer_reviews.text: This thing is beastly, it's huge, check, it's effect, check, and it's not over rgbd and looks minimalist while being the most performance orentiend board, my buddy's rog x299 can't overclock near as high as this one can.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Was worried when building that the board wouldnt fit the case, but got lucky.
customer_reviews.author: Steffen B

customer_reviews.title: great mobo!
customer_reviews.text: evga x299 ftw k mobo is a great, cpu inside is an intel 9800x with an overclock of 4..9ghz at 1.35v. 2080 sli
customer_reviews.author: Tony M.

customer_reviews.title: Overclock good!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bios Coin battery quality is bad! So i am change the battery. Battery change very difficult!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Jae Young

customer_reviews.title: It does what it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: This was the only Mobo that would fit in a microatx case and run my chosen processor so I didn't really have a choice. That said I had zero issues with it, it was an easy install. I always have my computer hardwired to the internet, so I can't say if the wifi chips are any good, I didn't bother to install them.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P.

customer_reviews.title: Bios Outdated
customer_reviews.text: After i finally hooked everything up the Bios ended up being out dated, i was getting a DF error code on the motherboard, the computer screen will not turn on, so now i cant eve manually update the bios, so they just told me to return it.
customer_reviews.author: abdul

customer_reviews.title: IT WORK FINE, OKAY.
customer_reviews.text: IT DOESN'T HAVE RGB FOUR PINS ON THIS MOTHERBOARD, OKAY.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley W.

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: OverclockersUK and gamers delight. This will help you reach your systems potential.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Owens

customer_reviews.title: It is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. It’s big, it’s bad it is beautiful... Easy overclock on 9900k to 5.2ghz. Fantastic to work with. Loving it...
customer_reviews.author: Walther

customer_reviews.title: For Overclocking Enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: One of the best Z390 motherboards I’ve ever owned! Great product by a great company!
customer_reviews.author: DHarkKnight10

customer_reviews.title: Great Intel 1151 socket MB
customer_reviews.text: Best motherboard I’ve had, refreshing that there’s no RGB on it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute quality and excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: Love this Motherboard. So far the best X299 board i have. very easy to OC and to high levels with my 9960X
customer_reviews.author: mats

customer_reviews.title: Evga x299 ftw k mobo
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly till it didnt. Less than a month in the new rig and it died. Buy at your own peril.
customer_reviews.author: douglas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality board with many features
customer_reviews.text: I love EVGA boards! They removed the lighting from the section above the CPU though, and I'm a little disheartened by that design choice..
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Speed is thy blessing and wow does it make sense...
customer_reviews.text: You need thy best Processor it is so fast that you will never need another " computer "...
customer_reviews.author: Amends-1

customer_reviews.title: Un grand Merci a Riley pour sa patience excellent pour la partie technique sur le chat et le ...
customer_reviews.text: Un grand Merci a Riley pour sa patience excellent pour la partie technique sur le chat et le suivi de colis merci beaucoup a lui .
customer_reviews.author: Beraudo
